page.title: 02Hadstock Village Shop
page.content: The village shop is a sub-Post Office and general stores. It sells groceries, sweets and cigarettes, household goods and stationery. The post for the people in Hadstock doesn't come to the Post Office in the village. It's delivered from Linton. The owners have been running the shop about five years, but the shop is eight or nine years old. They live in a house next door to the shop. It is the only shop in Hadstock, but there are mobile shops too (vans that come round selling various goods). They think it is a good way of making a living, and they hope that it will last much longer.
